mdRecord.dcterms:title: Map of the property of the Lexington Development Company at Lexington, Rockbridge County, Virginia August 15, 1891 / by D.C. Humphreys, Prof. Eng. Washington & Lee University, Lexington, Va. ; Engineers Chas. W. Forster & J.W. Link ; Field Assistant J.T. Morgan ; drawn by J.W. Link ; for more information apply to The Lexington Development Company, Lexington, Va
Lexington, an educational centre
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: A. Hoen & Co.
Humphreys, D. C.
Lexington Development Company (Lexington, Va))
Link, J. W.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Photo. Lith. by A. Hoen & Co.)
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 34 x 54 cm. on sheet 41 x 57 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Inset (separate scale, with radial distances): Map showing location of Lexington Virginia. 1890.
Three pictorial insets: Hotel de Hart, Lexington, Va. -- Main buildings of Washington and Lee University. Chartered 1782 -- Virginia Military Institute. Founded 1839.
Separate heading appears lower central map: Lexington an Educational Centre (listing Washington & Lee, Virginia Military Institute and Anne Smith Academy for Young Ladies.
Shows downtown Lexington, plus street names, numbered blocks and lots of the area owned by the Company.
